refnamediv.refpurpose: Mixes any waveform, resampled with either FFT or linear interpolation.

refsect1.title: Description
refsect1.para: This routine is similar to GEN31, but allows specifying source ftable for each partial. Tables can be resampled either with FFT, or linear interpolation.

refsect1.title: Syntax
refsect1.synopsis: f # time size 32 srca pna stra phsa srcb pnb strb phsb ...

refsect1.title: Performance
refsect1.para: srca, srcb -- source table number. A negative value can be used to read the table with linear interpolation (by default, the source waveform is transposed and phase shifted using FFT); this is less accurate, but faster, and allows non-integer and negative partial numbers.
pna, pnb, ... -- partial number, must be a positive integer if source table number is positive (i.e. resample with FFT).

refsect1.title: Examples
refsect1.para:
Here is an example of the GEN32 routine. It uses the file gen32.csd.
Example of the gen32 generator.
See the sections Real-time Audio and Command Line Flags for more information on using command line flags.
